text: Hello, friend. How did everyone's prerelease go?
Still waiting on mine, 6 pm tonight
Went 2-2 last night.  Great fun but went until 5 am so i@ responding in my sleep. Not sure what Freud would say about that.
<@U286Q175Y> it's funny how Battle for Zendikar made the cmc spike like that, those eldrazi were definitely the "in" thing
So have any of you guys played the card game Bang?
We played a ton of edh last night with the same rules as Bang and it was awesome. It made a 7 player game only take 40 minutes
I was thinking about writing an article down the road with different game variations I've come across, but this is by far my favorite I thhink
I've only played it once, but I can see how that would do it.
Oh shoot, that's a cool idea! Then there's planechase as another obvious variant
I think so but only once
Planechase EDH has the opposite effect.
Yea, Bang by itself might be my favorite board/card game to drink to, but Bang rules for edh made it really move forward instead of everyone trying to tiptoe around
Yea, I love planechase, but it can make games drag. It is an awesome variant though
My playgroup loves Bang! Magic. Our favorite multiplayer game by far. Always good times. I have never played a 7 game variant though... always 5.
We had a round of Planechase last night that opened with Naar Isle and Sea of Sand. We avoided all dying immediately, but the Planar Deck sure wanted it over

Hope you don't mind, but I'll share the article i wrote on our five player games... these are the rules we use
<http://www.mtgcasualplay.com/five-player-commander-games-edh-variants/>

attachments.title: EDH Commander 5 Player Games - Star Magic and Bang!
attachments.text: Hello there card drawers, welcome to <http://MTGCasualPlay.com|MTGCasualPlay.com>. Today I would like to share with you a couple of games that our playgroup dives into on EDH night w
attachments.fallback: MTG Casual Play: EDH Commander 5 Player Games - Star Magic and Bang!

text: Paradox engine gonna get banned? What yall think
We also did planechase last night, lost to Rhys on Goldmeadows to a billion craterhoofed goats.
<@U3RJ9VDRT>: fantastic
We got there, and the rest of the table was trying really, really hard to leave
<@U286Q175Y>: is it really that degenerate? I know it's very powerful, but is it that much more powerful than existing straightforward combos?
It seems like you need a decent investment to go infinite with it
it certainly makes a lot of combos more powerful,  that improvise giving card would be real nice in combo with it.
That would be nice, yeah
I haven't tested Paradox Engine, so grain of salt, but my gut feels that it won't be powerful enough to ban

I think it in itself isn't all degenerate, however it does allow redundant effects in some decks. My kozelik, buthcher of truth deck is going to want a copy, if only to have some more mana after the fourth time casting him
and I'm off to pre release
I think no ban
Maybe later
See at a prerelease: rishkar's expertise, draw 5, play sram's expertise for free, 3 servos, play silk weaver elite for free, draw a card off revolt trigger. Wut...
does paradox engine enable any combos easier than existing ones?
None come to mind. It's cute for Jeskai Ascendancy decks in particular, but I feel as though it's more redundancy than redonkulous
Paradox Engine is nuts with buyback spells
Get all your artifact mana and capsize their world. Seems ok
i’m thinking of building a Venser Shaper Savant deck that just bounces himself
add strionic resonator, panharmonicon

i agree though in general about no ban. i think it’s going to be a combo people finish games with, but it’s not better than other combos. I think what it has going for it is it can provide value without comboing out, kind of like PoK
Buuuuh, 2-1-1 tonight at my pre release, opened the mythic blue enchantment I needed for my Breya deck I'm building around woth
That draw, I conceded with 21 life and 10 min left in the round on game one

my AER updates:

*Marath Enchantress*
unbridled growth

*Kozilek, the GD*
Paradox Engine
Planar Bridge
Inspiring Statuary

*Oloro Mono Black Control*
nothin
Paradox engine is exactly where it needs to go
Don, what's your take on The Great Distortion? I've had a Butcher of Truth deck for a while, and I'm debating switching over to GD so as to make games more fun for my opponents

ive played both. i think TGD is more fun personally.

- you have to build around TGD more… the game plan is its ok to dump your hand because you’ll get it back, meanwhile BoT you can just draw whenever. I love Lions eye diamond in this deck
- By playing a bunch of eldrazi, you will still power out an early annihilator attack against someone, just now they expect it less. This was one of the reasons why I think TGD is better. 
- counterspelling things happens more times than you’d expect
Those are good points
Gosh an LED would be ridiculous
Perhaps I should finally make that swap
led is hilarious
*shudders*
I would absolutely love one for my Sharuum deck, given that it's eggs-centric
Though I think it's more likely that the Reserved List be abolished than I put that kind of money out for it
(Not that I think the Reserved List is going away any time soon)
i found my LED in my bulk box from when i was a kid
Hah, nice!
i thought it was garbage then
and it was, not sure it was broken then
Did it take the existence of the stack to do that?
im actually not even sure how it worked back then
IIRC, the truly crazy interactions come from being able to use the mana from LED to cast a spell before that card is discarded
nah you cant do that
common misconception
Discard your hand, Sacrifice Lion's Eye Diamond: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. *Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.*
Ah, fair
Is a mana ability, but can't really be activated like one
Makes sense
hehe yeah
from rulings: The ability is a mana ability, so it is activated and resolves as a mana ability, but it can only be activated at times when you can cast an instant. Yes, this is a bit weird.
That's a lovely note
Off topic but did anyone else get the chance to play lifecrafters bestiary at their prerelease? The card is pretty ridiculous, might just be an auto include in all my green decks now
I really liked it from the start. Card draw for one in decks that cast creature spells anyways? Yup. Animar decks feel like they keep getting better with cards like that
I had a feeling it'd be good but damn when I landed one turn 3 I just felt unstoppable lol
Yup. I got crushed by a double panharmonicon at the midnight. That felt sad
Oof, I opened the bestiary and ajani but had no anti aggro so i got run over in about 75% of my games
Excited to draft the set through
